comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Wikipedia appears to be unaware of her legal troubles: Mrs. Alden was the founder of the International Sunshine Society, a million-dollar charity, which operated sanitaria, a home for girls, an orphanage for blind babies, and other institutions. The Society's troubles began in 1913 when New York Attorney General Thomas Carmody held that it could not legally operate a home for blind babies under its charter. An investigation disclosed scandalously-casual accounting of donations and disbursements, and the possibility of graft. New York Times, June 18, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9D00E...
